image.altText: The sun sets over a beach.

props.synopsis: Parts of South Australia are bracing for catastrophic fire conditions amid a burst of early summer season heat, with neighbouring regions in Victoria also on high alert.

title.children: Catastrophic fire conditions forecast for parts of SA as CFS warns of 'very challenging' weather

image.altText: A police officer putting handcuffs on a man with hands behind his back in the backyard of a house

props.synopsis: A Colombian national living in Australia has been charged after he allegedly "unreasonably enforced" a small group of people to pay off debts, locked them inside a cupboard for days and restricted their communications.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly forcing daily chores on group, controlling earnings and tracking their movements

image.altText: Young boy in bucket hat and girl wearing garden gloves and leaning over planter beds

props.synopsis: Residents at an affordable apartment complex in Adelaide are taking part in a greening project intended to improve the wellbeing of young people who have spent time in state care, and reduce the amount of heat trapped in urban spaces.

title.children: For a young couple at risk of homelessness, a community garden is helping hope bloom

image.altText: A man with red hair in a navy blazer and white shirt stands talking into microphones.

props.synopsis: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs appears in court for the first time since being charged with drug offences.

title.children: Bail conditions allow ex-SA opposition leader David Speirs to travel overseas following drug charges

image.altText: A colourful box for the ordering of candidates in South Australia's First Nations Voice to Parliament elections.

props.synopsis: Four elected members and a senior staff member have resigned months after South Australia's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament elections were held, with one outgoing leader describing the model as "unsustainable".

title.children: SA's First Nations Voice to Parliament hit by resignations amid concerns about 'unsustainable' model

image.altText: A close up for a smiling man's face.

props.synopsis: The family of father of four Joe Koumera has been left waiting for answers after he died in the Riverland in October.

title.children: Family waiting for answers after death of PALM worker in SA

image.altText: Yuto Akihiro swings a baseball bat while standing in a grass field

props.synopsis: The tallest Japanese professional baseball player in history — standing at just over 2 metres tall — has joined the Adelaide Giants as the club aims to win a third straight Australian Baseball League championship.

title.children: Japan's tallest baseball player joins Giants for Australian season

image.altText: Will Brown

props.synopsis: The Adelaide 500 motorsport carnival kicks off today on a street circuit revered across the globe, as past legends recall the inaugural event held in 1999 and what made it so special.

title.children: From a 'barmy' concept to 'benchmark' event for the Supercars, Adelaide 500 celebrates 25 years

image.altText: Two suited men exchange a handshake

props.synopsis: While Donald Trump may be "thrilled" to nominate Robert F Kennedy Jr to head America's health agency, experts say he's "completely unqualified" for the job. Here's why.

title.children: 'Go have a good time, Bobby': What Trump’s RFK Jr nomination means for America

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has found strata contracts promoted by a key industry body disproportionately favour managers over apartment owners, sparking calls for an urgent review to reform the agreements.

title.children: How 'appalling' and 'disgraceful' strata contracts favour managers over apartment owners

image.altText: Two men stand outside of US Supreme Court

props.synopsis: It has once again clashed with its parent company Unilever over its stance on Gaza, leading to a lawsuit alleging Unilever has silenced efforts to express support for Palestinian refugees.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's is suing parent company Unilever for the second time over its stance on Gaza

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A colleague of a police officer who tasered a great-grandmother has told a court about a conversation they had after the officer got back to the station.

title.children: Police officer accused of manslaughter told colleague he 'needed to' taser 95yo woman, court hears

image.altText: An exterior shot of an ANU building.

props.synopsis: An Australian National University associate professor sharply criticises Australia's domestic intelligence agency, saying it asked her to report on Chinese international students and put a "chill" on China research as the bilateral relationship deteriorated.

title.children: 'Atmosphere of fear': Academic says spy agency asked her to report on Chinese students

image.altText: Mike Tyson hits Jake Paul in the face at the weigh-in before their boxing fight.

props.synopsis: Boxing legend Mike Tyson is getting in the ring with influencer-turned-fighter Jake Paul for a fight night hosted by Netflix. Here's how to watch, when to tune in and everything else you need to know.

title.children: Why did Mike Tyson slap Jake Paul? And all your other questions answered ahead of their boxing bout

image.altText: A screenshot from a website listing a tractor for sale with a giant red FAKE stamp on top

props.synopsis: These farmers bought used tractors from a website that looked like the real deal. Instead, they fell into a trap laid by scammers using a Russian-linked website to pose as a legitimate Sydney-based business.

title.children: At least three Australian farmers have fallen victim to a sophisticated tractor scam

image.altText: A man sitting on an Indigenous child (face blurred) on grass, as another man moves his knee towards the child.

props.synopsis: More than a year after former Barkly mayor Jeff McLaughlin was filmed restraining a child in a so-called citizen's arrest, police have closed their investigation into the incident "with no criminal prosecution to occur".

title.children: Now-sacked NT outback mayor cleared by police over controversial 'citizen's arrest' video

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market closed higher on Friday. Corporate regulator warns of further action against the $4 trillion superannuation industry. Catch up on the day's events as they happened on the ABC News markets blog.

title.children: ASX closes higher, while another economist pushes back rate cut expectations to May — as it happened

image.altText: A man crouching amid concrete rubble.

props.synopsis: The vote by Australia in a UN committee puts the country at odds with the United States and Israel, and has angered Australia's Jewish lobby groups.

title.children: Australia backs draft UN proposal recognising Palestinians' 'sovereignty' over land, water and electricity

image.altText: a boy sitting on a bike next to his parents in the 1970s

props.synopsis: As Darwin approaches 50 years since Cyclone Tracy struck, survivors have expressed outrage at the local council's memorial plans.

title.children: Cyclone Tracy survivors furious a controversial artwork will get a special opening and say council has got it all wrong

image.altText: Blue cranes move shipping containers at new port in Chancay

props.synopsis: The new megaport is 992 hectares in size and creates a direct link between Shanghai and Peru and will cut shipment times down by 20 days on some routes.

title.children: China's new $5.3 billion Peruvian megaport officially open for business

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: Two new clinics providing abortion services are set to be established in Queanbeyan and NSW's south coast. It comes after an ABC investigation exposed that Queanbeyan Hospital had ceased providing surgical terminations.

title.children: Surgical abortions at Queanbeyan Hospital to be reinstated

image.altText: A photo from the show of three men sitting inside a truck.

props.synopsis: With authentic one-liners like "shut ya hole" and plenty of other relatable moments in the Australian Outback, the new Netflix series Territory has generated over 15 million views.

title.children: 'How not to do a Jamie Oliver': Netflix series Territory went where many shows were 'not brave enough'

image.altText: court exterior.

props.synopsis: LN has spent 10 days giving evidence and on her final day in the witness box she has told jurors "it's not an act".

title.children: 'My life is a sh*t show': Woman with multiple personalities denies role-playing in court

image.altText: Millie Elliott shows offer her premiership ring while posing with her family after the Sydney Roosters won the NRLW grand final.

props.synopsis: Police say a month-long investigation led them to a business in Newcastle where the ring was found. Two men have since been arrested and have faced court.

title.children: Two men charged over alleged theft of Millie Elliott's 2024 NRLW premiership ring

image.altText: Two Melbourne Stars WBBL players before a match in 2018.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia has slapped former Sri Lanka Test player Dulip Samaraweera with another ban after allegations of inappropriate behaviour towards a second player while coaching.

title.children: Former Test cricketer handed second ban over allegations of inappropriate behaviour

image.altText: Bear suit

props.synopsis: A bear caught on camera breaking into luxury cars in the mountains east of Los Angeles was "clearly a human in a bear suit", according to the California Department of Insurance.

title.children: Insurers say a 'bear' that damaged luxury cars in California was 'clearly a human in a bear suit'

image.altText: Silhouette of a car in front of a building fire.

props.synopsis: Police say a string of fiery ram raids on tobacconists in northern NSW is part of a nation-wide turf war in the illicit tobacco racket.

title.children: Thieves allegedly try to run over witness to fiery tobacco ram raids linked to national 'turf wars'

image.altText: Infowars founder Alex Jones looking sideways, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Alex Jones owes $1.5 billion after defaming the families of those killed in the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings, claiming it was a hoax staged by crisis actors.

title.children: The Onion buys conspiracy website Infowars after $1.5b ruling against founder Alex Jones

image.altText: A Bluey Christmas window display.

props.synopsis: A pro-Palestinian protest outside the Myer windows "will not go ahead" after the department store cancelled Sunday's official unveiling of its popular Christmas display due to the planned disruption.

title.children: Planned pro-Palestinian protest 'will not go ahead' after Myer cancels unveiling of Christmas windows

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: New research reveals senior academics at Australian universities favoured white prospective PhD students. These students say their experiences echo the findings.

title.children: PhD graduates back study indicating racist bias among academics at Australian universities

image.altText: Young blonde man taking a selfie in an elevator. He is smiling and doing a peace sign with hand.

props.synopsis: When your sense of your own identity gets attached to your job, how do you move on when you're let go? Studies suggest younger workers are more likely than older people to be sacked or made redundant. So what should you do if this happens to you?

title.children: 'Am I just young and stupid?' Young Australians on being made redundant

image.altText: A woman smiles as she holds a rabbit in a rural setting.

props.synopsis: As a Wiggle, Emma Watkins became a bigger rock star than actual rock stars to kids and parents everywhere. Since leaving the group three years ago, she's been busier than ever.

title.children: 'How can we bring magic to everything we do?': Ex-Wiggle Emma Watkins has a new audiobook and a new mission

image.altText: An aerial view of a round mine shaft opening in rocky terrain, with eight white vehivles parked nearby

props.synopsis: The South African government says it will not help a group of illegal miners inside a closed mine in the country's North West province who have been denied access to basic supplies as part of an official strategy against illegal mining.

title.children: Hundreds of miners denied water underground as South African government moves to 'smoke out' illegal migrants

image.altText: Elon Mus raises his fist as Donald Trump speaks at the podium

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Think you've been paying attention to the news?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Musk goes into politics for real, a koala sneaks inside and the prestigious Booker Prize
